Award.AwardTitle: RUI: Experimental and Theoretical Investigation of Alkylidenecarbenes from Methylenecyclopropanes
Award.AbstractNarration:
The Chemical Structure, Dynamics, and Mechanisms - B Program of the Division of Chemistry supports Professor Dasan M. Thamattoor of Colby College, in an undergraduate-driven research program, to investigate alkylidenecarbenes generated from new photochemical sources based on cyclopropanated phenanthrene and indan systems. The program includes the study of acyclic alkylidenecarbenes with alkyl and aryl substituents, the investigation of cycloalkylidenecarbenes, with a particular emphasis on their ability to generate small- and medium-ring cycloalkynes, the study of dihalovinylidenes, and the domino generation of two alkylidenecarbenes from a single precursor and the formation of C2.

This research program provides a research experience for undergraduate students, which trains them in the synthesis of organic molecules and in the physical methods used to characterize these molecules and determine their structures. The work will continue an outreach program that provides research opportunities to high school students over the summer months. Also, the implementation of new partnerships with math and science teachers at local elementary and middle schools, to deliver quality instruction in STEM subjects, will be sought and existing ones strengthened.

Institution.Name: Colby College
Institution.ORG_LGL_BUS_NAME: PRESIDENT AND TRUSTEES OF COLBY COLLEGE, THE

ProgramReference.Text: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

POR.DRECONTENT:
Intellectual Merit: With this award the P.I. and his students have successfully generated several vinylidenecarbenes and investigated their structure and reactivity by experimental and computational methods. Perhaps the most exciting result is the application of their approach to generate highly strained carbocyclic and heterocyclic alkynes. by ring expansion of cyclic alkylidenecarbenes. Over the course of this award, a total of 22 undergraduates were provided research opportunities in the P.I.’s laboratory. These activities encompassed synthetic, mechanistic, and computational organic chemistry. The students learned to search the chemistry literature; design and execute air- and moisture-sensitive reactions; isolate, purify, and characterize reaction products; learn to use research grade instrumentation such as GCMS, LCMS, NMR, IR, UV-vis, X-ray diffractometer, etc.; conduct mechanistic studies; perform high level calculations; present their work in written and oral formats; and publish in peer-reviewed journals. Funds from two supplemental awards were used to support 6 undergraduate students and the P.I. to undertake  collaborative research work at Ruhr Universität in Bochum, Germany. 

Broader Impact: The P.I. also carried out outreach activities to support K-12 STEM education. This included sponsoring the local middle school and junior high school robotics teams; supporting the participation of the local high school Science Olympiad at the nationals; donating UV-vis spectrometers to the local high school to enhance laboratory training; donating assistive technologies to the special education department to help students with earning differences; and hosting a total of 18 high school students as summer research interns.

The following papers, which acknowledge support from this grant, have been published. Colby undergraduate coauthors are shown in bold and high school student coauthors are underlined.

  • Fan, R.; Wen, Y.; Thamattoor, D. M. “Photochemical Generation and Trapping of 3-Oxacyclohexyne” Org. Biomol. Chem., 2017, 15, 8270.
  • Maurer, D. P.; Fan, R.; Thamattoor, D. M. “Photochemical Generation of Strained Cycloalkynes from Methylenecyclopropanes” Angew. Chem. Int. Ed. 2017, 56, 4499.
  • Kim, N. S.; Thamattoor, D. M. “Crystal Structure of 4,5-Dibromophenanthrene” Acta Cryst. E73 2017, 539.
  • Miles, W. H.; Robinson, M. J.; Lessard, S. G.; Thamattoor, D. M. “Through-Space Shielding Effects of Metal-Complexed Phenyl Rings” J. Org. Chem. 2016, 81, 10791.
  • Yang, X.; Languet, K. L.; Thamattoor, D. M. “An Experimental and Computational Investigation of (α-Methylbenzylidene)carbene” J. Org. Chem. 2016, 81, 8194.
  • Hardikar, T. S.; Warren, M. A.; Thamattoor, D. M. "Photochemistry of 1-(propan-2-ylidene)-1a,9b-dihydro-1H-cyclopropa[l]phenanthrene" Tetrahedron Lett. 2015, 56, 6751.
  • Goldstein, R. I.; Guo, R.; Hughes, C.; Maurer, D. P.; Newhouse, T. R.; Sisto, T. J.; Conry, R. R.; Price, S. L.; Thamattoor, D. M. “Concomitant Conformational Dimorphism in 1,2-Bis(9-anthryl)acetylene” CrystEngComm 2015, 17, 4877.

The following is a list of presentations at conferences that acknowledge support from this award. Colby undergraduate coauthors are shown in bold and high school student coauthors are underlined.

  • Wen,Y.; Michie, M. S.; Thamattoor, D. M. “Propadienylidene: Photochemical Generation and Trapping in Solution” presented at the International Symposium on Reactive Intermediates and Unusual Molecules, Sorrento, Italy, in June, 2017.
  • Le, N. N. T.; Dasan M. Thamattoor “Bpin Carbene: A Computational Study and Experimental Approach” presented at the International Symposium on Reactive Intermediates and Unusual Molecules, Sorrento, Italy, in June, 2017.
  • Hardikar, T. S.; Thamattoor, D. M.  “Diphenylketene from a Phenanthrene-based Cyclobutanone” presented at the International Symposium on Reactive Intermediates and Unusual Molecules, Sorrento, Italy, in June, 2017.
  • Fan, R.; Thamattoor, D. M. Poster “Photochemical Generation of 3-Oxacyclohexyne” presented at the International Symposium on Reactive Intermediates and Unusual Molecules, Sorrento, Italy, in June, 2017.
  • Maurer, D. M.; Fan, R.; Thamattoor, D. M. “Photochemical Generation of Strained Cycloalkynes from Methylenecyclopropanes” Poster presented at the 23rd IUPAC International Conference on Physical Organic Chemistry, University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia in July, 2016.
  • Yang, X.; Languet, K. L.; Thamattoor, D. M. “An Experimental and Computational Investigation of (α-Methylbenzylidene)carbene” Poster presented at the 23rd IUPAC International Conference on Physical Organic Chemistry, University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia in July, 2016.
  • Jojo, J.; Chakraborty, M.; Suzuki, J. M.; Flanders, N.; Thamattoor, D. M.; Hadad, C. M. “Ultrafast infrared and computational study of the formation of alkynylcarbenes from cyclopropanated phenanthrene derivatives” Poster presented at the 250th National Meeting of the American Chemical Society in Boston, MA in August 16-20, 2015.
  • DeAngelo, J. D.; Thamattoor, D. M. “Chemistry of 3-(1a,9b-dihydro-1H-cyclopropa-[l]phenanthren-1-yl)- 2,2,4,4-tetramethylpentan-3-ol” Poster presented at the International Symposium on Reactive Intermediates and Unusual Molecules, Hiroshima, Japan; April 1-6, 2014.

Last Modified: 10/29/2017
Modified by: Dasan M Thamattoor
